sentence.Network_en: His anti-Semitic beliefs were well-known in America.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的反犹信仰在美国很出名。

sentence.Network_en: He was a patriarchal Semitic nomad.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是族长制闪米特游牧部落的一员.

sentence.Network_en: The Semitic peoples followed close upon these pioneers.
sentence.Network_cn: 紧跟在这些先行者之后的是闪米特人.

list.abs: ...奋斗》中表示他既是思想家同时也是实干者，想出在夺权后会如何对待犹太人的蓝图。1919年，当希特拉还在军队的时候就已写了一封信定义他怎样去理解「理性的反犹太主义」(rational anti-semitism) 他表示首先要做的是有计划地移除犹太人所有的法定权利。之后就是彻底灭绝。之后他又在纳粹党办的报纸撰文，建议要将「病毒」封锁在「集中营」以保护.

entry.tran: 闪米特语族的，闪语的(包括阿拉伯语和希伯来语)
entry.def: Semitic languages are a group of languages that include Arabic and Hebrew.
Semitic people belong to one of the groups of people who speak a Semitic language.
Semitic is sometimes used to mean Jewish.

means.word_mean: 1. a major branch of the Afro-Asiatic language family
1. of or relating to the group of Semitic languages;
2. of or relating to or characteristic of Semites;
